intro: Rubus hirtus var. neamtui, commonly known as the Neamț raspberry, is a variant of the brambles native to southeastern Europe. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when ripe, with a tart flavor. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forest edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubus genus, with unique adaptations to its native habitat.
